raw_comment:
What do you notice?
That elite colleges pay attention to a whole lot more than students grades and tests. They look at how wealthy your parents are or how poor they are. They also look at if your parents have gone to an elite school before.

What do you wonder?
Why do these elite schools only care about money so much  more than your grades and test scores. 

How does this relate to you and your community?
This relates to me because I am a student who wants to go to college and to make it to those elite schools.

Create a catchy headline that captures the graphâ€™s main idea.
"Elite schools for the rich."
ace_sentences: Elite colleges pay attention to more than students' grades and test scores.
Elite colleges consider how wealthy the parents of a student are.
Elite colleges consider how poor the parents of a student are.
Elite colleges consider whether the parents of a student attended an elite school before.
I wonder why elite schools care about money more than grades and test scores.
This relates to me because I am a student.
I want to go to college.
I want to attend an elite school.
The headline is: Elite schools for the rich.
